content:
When logging on to Thunderbird, how do I have all emails downloaded to an external hard drive? I am not referring to the backup of email to had. I wish to have Thunderbird have all its data on ext had. I installed TB on the ext HD.

I want everything relating to Thunderbird to reside on an external USB HD.

title: Moving unread emails to a subfolder doesn't remove them from main UNREAD folder
creator: gcwesq
content: In Tbird emails (115.6.1), I have an UNREAD folder, and numerous subfolders under INBOX. There appears to have been a change a few months ago. I used to be able to move an unread email from UNREAD to a subfolder, and it would disappear from the UNREAD folder. That no longer happens. I want it to happen, because then I can see which emails (in the UNREAD folder) still need my attention. I don't want to mark the email as 'read', because then it won't show as 'unread' in the subfolder, which I want it to do, as I then know it needs further attention, and because it makes that subfolder show in the list of subfolders that have unread messages in them. I don't want to have the same unread email in both the UNREAD folder and in the subfolder. This used to work, but now it doesn't. Any ideas greatly appreciated. Thanks.
metadata: ;category:customize;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/120.0.0.0 Safari/537.36;product:thunderbird;solver_id:5720980

creator: wanderer.in.the.universe
content: Hello. I have two mailboxes. One is configured via POP3, the other via IMAP. It is necessary to transfer several folders (over 100) from POP3 to IMAP at once. Previously, it was possible to select several folders at once and move them. Now I can only transfer one folder at a time. I tried to go to the profile folder and just copy the folder files from there, but when Thunderbird is turned on, these folders are immediately deleted. Is there any other way? Thank you in advance.

title: SSL Certificate Expired, but from where
creator: mozilla520
content:
I have recently started receiving an expired SSL warning from my A/V that a certificate is expired, thunderbird is indicated to be the application attempting the connection.

After looking at the certificate reported it is, indeed, expired, however I don't know where it is coming from, the domain reported is not one of the domains I check email on, (but it is the root domain for the CPanel hosting that those domains sit on).

How can I find out just what certificate it is finding, and how can I resolve it, all of the domains SSL certs are reported as up2date on other apps, including Firefox.

Where is thunderbird trying to go?
metadata: ;category:privacy-and-security;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/120.0.0.0 Safari/537.36;product:thunderbird;solver_id:5721192

title: The little paperclip attachment button has vanished from my inbox and all my attachments have disappeared
creator: djcooper1
content: The little paperclip attachment button has vanished from my inbox and all my attachments have disappeared. I've tried googling for a solution but I don't understand the techie stuff and I need to do my tax form and information I need for it is in some of these attachements that have vanished and my husband is away and I can't reach him and I'm totally desperate. I'm in such a panic I can't think. The little red X marks where the paperclip button was but it's gone now and I just can't think how I can meet the deadline for the tax form and so much vital information has just vanished and I don't know what to do. I'm desperate I don't understand the techie stuff when I google and I don't know what to do Can anyone please help me get them back or are they gone for ever? I'm desperate I'm snowed in on the farm and no one can come to help me and I'm just in such a panic

title: Always display only unread emails in Thunderbird
creator: joy19
content:
Hi,

I have about 8 email accounts in Thunderbird, most with 20+ folders in each.

Everytime I move into a folder I have to set the filter to show only unread and in date order. Then as soon as I move to the next folder / email account, or exit Thunderbird, I have to do it again for every folder.

Likewise I always want to View Threaded.

What I want to do is keep these settings permanently over all accounts and folders. Is there a simple global way to set this please?

I'm sure I had it set up like this at one time but since about October it all changed.

title: PDF megnyitás probléma
creator: geza.fulop
content:
Sziasztok!

Folyamatosan már 2-3 hónapja rendszeresen előjön ugyanaz a hiba. Minden frissítés után. IMAP szervert használunk és a PDF csatolmányok közül néhány nem nyílik meg, ha elmentjük, akkor hibás a csatolt fájl. Valójában nem az, csak letöltésnél történik vele valami, mert más levelező programban, nincs ilyen probléma. Olvastam megoldásokat, ami megcsináltam és után jó volt egy darabig, aztán megint nem. Utána valami más dolgot kellett állítani, aztán megint valami más volt a hiba. Kérdésem az lenne, hogy most mi lehet a hiba? Természetesen a 01.08-as frissítés már megtörtént, azóta van ismét probléma a pdf megnyitással.
metadata: ;category:fix-problems;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:121.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/121.0;product:thunderbird

title: Problema ricezione e invio mail
creator: danielebortolo006
content: Buongiorno a tutti, dal mio PC gestisco 4 mail tramite Thunderbird. 3 Aruba e una interfree. Da un paio di mesi a questa parte ho difficoltà sia a ricevere che inviare mail. All'invio mi compare il messaggio di errore collegamento al server, e a volte ricevo le mail il giorno dopo. Forse è semplicemente un problema di rete, ma come faccio per testare Thunderbird ed essere sicuro non sia un problema dell'app o una configurazione sbagliata della mail? Sono due mail pop e due imap. Gli errori non si verificano sempre, a volta lavoro una settimana senza problemi e a volte sono fermo in intero giorno, e riavviando il computer quando si presenta un problema non risolve. Non so se questo ha una qualche influenza sul problema, ma qualche settimana fa mi sono arrivate 3 mail corrotte con data 01/01/1970 e altre mail vecchie di qualche mese che avevo già provveduto ad eliminare. Ricapitolando vorrei verificare che il programma funzioni e di aver impostato tutti i valori corretti, grazie
metadata: ;category:fix-problems;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Linux; Android 10; K) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/120.0.0.0 Mobile Safari/537.36;product:thunderbird

title: Thunderbird Ver. 115.6.1
creator: wayne97
content:
I installed Thunderbird 115.6.1 and it will not send or receive email. I uninstalled Thunderbird and scoured the Windows 10 Registry with CCleaner. When reinstalling Tbird 115.6.1 it works until I reboot then it fails again.

I have checked the serer setting for the Incoming and Outgong servers and they are correct.

My PC goes online without a hitch with Firefox, Tor, Vivaldi, and DuckDuckGo browsers. The Internet connection is solid. Note: Firefox was misbehaving in that it would not fully open some sights. In Windows Programs and Features I found and executed a Repair function for Firefox and that solved that problem. This saved me from uninstalling, flushing the Registry, and reinstalling. I thought it may clear the Tbird problem, but it did not.

I am quite technically savvy as I used PC since they were on the market and never ask for help until I've exhausted every possible fox. This problem is one for the history books and eludes me.

Error message is that the server is not responding. eMClient email software works without a problem as does using Web mail through Firefox or another browser. Your help is most appreciated, or a link where i may download a previous version of Thunderbird. Thank you, your help is warmly appreciated.

Wayne English Wayne@WayneAEnglish.com WayneAEnglish.com
metadata: ;category:fix-problems;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:121.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/121.0;product:thunderbird

content:

Also, for a message that has several replies, my preference is to view it unthreaded but Thunderbird keeps changing it back to Threaded. I can change that setting but how do I make that default?

title: Error sending templates only
creator: carisa2
content:
So, I updated to 115.6.1 and ever since then I haven't been able to send an email template from only one of my 10 accounts. It is an IMAP account. The crazy thing is that I can't even copy the template and send it or forward it, nothing. It still errors out with the message:

A message that you sent could not be delivered to one or more of its recipients. This is a permanent error. The following address(es) failed: 

 b*(deleting for security)@yahoo.com    host eig-east.smtp.a.cloudfilter.net [3.228.35.199]    SMTP error from remote mail server after end of data:    550 KQwyro95RqkaTKQwyr2zRa - <carisa@p*.com> message rejected AUP#SNDR

Reporting-MTA: dns; box5*.bluehost.com

Action: failed Final-Recipient: b*@yahoo.com Status: 5.0.0 Remote-MTA: dns; eig-east.smtp.a.cloudfilter.net Diagnostic-Code: smtp; 550 KQwyro95RqkaTKQwyr2zRa - <carisa@p*.com> message rejected AUP#SNDR

I have deleted the account and reinstalled. Didn't help. I've tried to make a new template. It won't save. I've deleted all add-ons and extensions. I am at a loss. I am having to use a different email client to send templates and they work just fine, by the way. I can reply and send new emails in this account with no problem. The only thing I haven't done is uninstall and reinstall of Thunderbird, which I'm trying to avoid because of POP emails that I have on a different account that I don't want to lose. What am I missing?

title: Several accounts with one server, but only one of them cannot receive emails in Thunderbird 115.6.1 (32 bit)
creator: jumblejim
content:
I have six email accounts, all through ATT/Yahoo/Prodigy's server. All of them can send emails. One of them suddenly stopped receiving emails five days ago. I'm using Thunderbird 115.6.1 (32 bit) in Windows 10 Home version 22H2.

I'm using POP3 for all accounts, inbound server inbound.att.net, port 995, default 995. Connection security SSL/TLS. The one account that stopped receiving emails is set up exactly like the other accounts which still receive email. I can receive that accounts emails on the server in a browser, and also in my iPhone and Macbook email programs. Only my PC described above does not receive emails.

Any ideas?
